conclusion: The task is to predict whether liquid from A, B, and C will flow into container D or E after passing through baffles.
Container A is located at the top left, marked in yellow, and has a gray baffle below it.
Container B is located at the top center, marked in blue, and has a cyan baffle below it.
Container C is located at the top right, marked in green, and has a green baffle below it.
There are multiple baffles of different colors and orientations below containers A, B, and C, which guide the flow of liquid.
At the bottom of the image, there are two containers: D (red) and E (brown), positioned to collect liquid.
Liquid from A will flow downwards and hit the gray baffle, which directs it to the left.
After being directed left by the gray baffle, the liquid from A will continue to flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow downwards and hit the cyan baffle, which directs it to the right.
After being directed right by the cyan baffle, the liquid from B will continue to flow into container E.
Liquid from C will flow downwards and hit the green baffle, which directs it to the right.
After being directed right by the green baffle, the liquid from C will continue to flow into container E.
